title: On-boarding East Asia Today!
description: Despite a population of billions, East Asians are underrepresented in Catalyst due to a lack of localised content.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great proposal by a strong team of committed catalyst members involved in the Eastern Town hall to set up a process to produce translated information for east Asia. A semi-automated process will be set up, with some automation, but all final documents reviewed and finalized by humans. Huge scope for a very minimal amount of funding.
f6_assessments.q1: This is a strong plan by a committed and experienced team which will leverage the Catalyst community to set up a process to provide translation of Cardano documentation for their East Asian communities. Work has already been started and minimal funding requested to get the system up and running as a proof of concept. High probability this will be achieved in the 3 month window set.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is to set up a proof on concept translation pipeline and thus easily auditable. It might be nice to produce some metrics around eastern townhall membership and growth that this helps service will help to facilitate.

f6_assessments.q0: It's really a great project, There's a lot of opportunity for growth and development in Asia, to utilize them, language is a big barrier now, setting up automation pipelines would be great to minimize these issues.
f6_assessments.q1: Catalyst swarm, eastern townhall's are going great, this proposal would add so much value, and seeing the work of the proposers have done already, this would be a great plus to the eco-system and their plan of execution is also looking convenient.
f6_assessments.q2: A year-ahead timeline and the regular eastern Asia town hall meetings are a great way to audit the progresses.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal was to setup a translation pipeline that will translate catalyst documentation & proposals across as many languages in East Asia as possible which effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposers are co-Founders of Catalyst Swarm, Eastern Townhall, Catalyst School. IT & Software Engineering. educators and accountant in East Asia & Japan which is very capable on implementing the proposal. The plan's initial objective is simple: to get a lot of existing Cardano and Catalyst material translated into as many languages of the East and Southeast Asian regions using a semi-automated system. Gaining experience and building community.
f6_assessments.q2: The key performance indicators (KPIs) are well thought-out, and the timeline is reasonable. The ability to audit will come from Github activity and engagement section.

f6_assessments.q0:

Yes. Despite a population of billions, East Asians are underrepresented in Catalyst due to a lack of localised content.

Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
 Yes

Yes

 Yes

 Yes

 Yes


This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system

Yes.

Yes

Yes

Yes

Yes. He has stated  team structure

Yes

No plan for additional funds

Yes

Yes

Yes

Yes

Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
Yes

Yes

Yes

Yes

No 

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
No plan given

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
No 


I recommend this plan because the budget is  reasonable.  Costs of development are very cost effective. Team members are clearly laid out     Proposal is clear and systematic and appears achievable.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is set out clearly and as an East Asian I can deeply feel the difficulty in tackling this particular challenge. Not to mention the China crackdown (If Chinese will be one of the translation languages).

The proposal also outlines the evolved challenges as time progresses. A roadmap taking this into consideration is laid out for community consideration.

A problem which came to light is how will the translated information be distributed, will it just be a multi-lingual resource like a website's manual?
f6_assessments.q1:
The pipeline looks really feasible. With the team outlined, this project looks really promising and can really benefit the Cardano community. 

The translation pipeline is not hard to implement, a lot of estalished companies/frameworks/SOP are already out there for reference. This is also not a new technology but a great addition to current ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and milestones are clear and concise. It will be easy to track the progress.

solution: Setup a translation pipeline that will translate catalyst documentation & proposals across as many languages in East Asia as possible.
experience: Co-Founders of Catalyst Swarm, Eastern Townhall, Catalyst School. IT & Software Engineering. educators and accountant in East Asia & Japan.
